posts.name: Ethan Pernal
posts.cooked:
Hi all,

We just got in our order of Neo Vortex motors and sparkmaxs after the recall, and unfortunately we will need to gear these motors down for what we intend to use them for.

We thought our old versapalnetary gearboxes would fit the whole pattern on the sparkmax but they are slightly off by what looks like a few millimeters. We looked into the max planetary but those seem all out of stock without any estimated date for new ones coming into stock.

Any suggestions for how to proceed to get a planetary gearbox on pur sparkmaxs/neo vortexs? Right now our only solution will be to drill larger holes into the mounting wholes on the versa planetarys and rolling with it
You really do not want to use a planetary for gearing up. Try an overdrive .

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.custom_user_title: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.name: Ethan Pernal
posts.cooked: Sorry, correction we are gearing down

Do you have any CIM adapters ? these should line up with the holes on the Solo Adapter and you will not need to cut the shaft.

Make sure that you are looking at the correct holes. There are 2 sets and the # 10 holes should be on the correct 2 in circle . You will need to cut the shaft, however.

AM also has the CIM Sport . These should work as well, however they are non modular.

posts.name: Kevin S
posts.cooked:
Anywhere that has a 2in diam hole pattern (cim mounting holes), you should be able to use a vortex with a sparkflex/solo adapter and an 8mm keyed shaft output.

For the versaplanetary gearboxes you might need a ‚Äú VersaPlanetary CIM Adapter‚Äù.

posts.name: Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)
posts.cooked:
Couple things:

You‚Äôre probably using SPARK Flex controllers with your NEO Vortex.  The SPARK MAX is different and usually used with NEO 1.0/1.1/550 motors (though with an adapter it can drive a NEO Vortex).

Whether you‚Äôre using a SPARK Flex or the adapter, the mounting holes on the front face are for 10-32 screws on a 2" bolt circle.  Same as a CIM , which the VersaPlanetary natively supports with their (voluminous but necessary) adapter.

MAXPlanetary base kits are due back end of the month per REV‚Äôs stock updates page .  If that doesn‚Äôt fit your timeline and you want to move on from the VersaPlanetary, I‚Äôd consider the CIM Sport gearbox .  If you have the ability to press-fit a pinion, consider the short back block option .  You‚Äôll lose the modularity of the VP/MP, but you‚Äôll get a well-built gearbox that can do the work.

posts.name: Saber_8871
posts.cooked: What kind of filament and infill is being used here? though iirc, this doesnt solve the issue of not having the input gear that comes with the base kit.

posts.name: Duncan Macdonald
posts.cooked:
Onyx with a few extra walls because we lack self confidence is our usual print setting‚Ä¶ If we had applied even one braincell to this part we could have made the flanges thicker too. This is just the step from the REV website because we thought we could buy the real one eventually.

If you‚Äôre not using 8mm motor shafts shafts (ie. not Neo 1.x or cim) you can still buy the input coupler that doesn‚Äôt come in the base kit anyway. ( MAXPlanetary Input Couplers - REV Robotics )

And if you are using the Max 90 degree output ( MAX 90 Degree Gearbox - REV Robotics ) this printed part is the only part you need to substitute from the base kit.
